intro: Gagea lutea var. monantha, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
